original: Ljunggren, Olof, fd. lektor, Göteborg, f. 29/8/80 i Glostorp, Malmöh. 1., av Rasmus L. o. Margareta Nilsson. G. 09’ m. Davida Bengtsson. Barn: Nils-Olof f. 15, leg. läk., und:-läk. v. Garn:sjukh., Sthlm, Lars 21, jur. stud., Gbg. — Mog:ex. i Malmö 01, fil. kand. i Lund 04, teol. kand. 06, teol. lic. 10, prästv. f. Lunds stift 13, provår 09-10. Extralär. v. Malmö realsk. 08-09, vik. adj. i Lund 10-11, vik. lektor där 11-12 o. extralär. 12-13, lar. v. Lunds fullst. lärov. f. fl. 10-14, adj. i Halmstad 13, v. Gbgs folksk:-sem. 14, lektor i kristend :kunsk. o. hist. där 18 t. pens. 45, lär. v. Gbgs samsk. 14-19, Gbgs flickgymn. 15-44, ensk. gymn. 18-19. Därjämte åtskill. prästerl. förordn. Malmö nat. i Lund kur. 10-12, sekr. h. Akad. fören. överstyr. 05-07, led. av dess ekon. utsk. 12-13, styriled. i Teol. fören. 11-12, dess v. ordf. 12-13, suppl. i kyrkoråd 28-29, därefter ord. led. Stud:vist. i Tyskl. 07-08 o. 30. Skr.: Bönen i Gamla Test. (akad. avh. 14), Bibelns användn. i övn :sk. o. på sem.. Bilder ur kyrkans hist. f. folksk. (34), rec. m. m. LNO.
translated: Ljunggren, Olof, former lecturer, Gothenburg, born on August 29, 1880 in Glostorp, Malmöh. 1st child of Rasmus L. and Margareta Nilsson. Married in 1909 to Davida Bengtsson. Children: Nils-Olof, born in 1915, licensed doctor, assistant doctor at the Garrison Hospital in Stockholm, Lars, 21 years old, studying law in Gothenburg. Graduated from Malmö school in 1901, obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree from Lund in 1904, Bachelor of Theology in 1906, Licentiate of Theology in 1910, ordained as a priest for the Diocese of Lund in 1913, trial period from 1909-1910. Extra teacher at Malmö realskola from 1908-1909, substitute curate in Lund from 1910-1911, substitute lecturer there from 1911-1912, extra teacher from 1912-1913, teacher at Lund comprehensive school from 1910-1914, curate in Halmstad in 1913, teacher at Gothenburg teacher training seminar in 1914, lecturer in Christian knowledge and history there from 1918 until retirement in 1945, teacher at Gothenburg secondary school from 1914-1919, Gothenburg girls' gymnasium from 1915-1944, private gymnasium from 1918-1919. Also held various clerical appointments, Secretary of the National Institute in Lund from 1910-1912, member of its economic committee from 1912-1913, board member of the Theological Society from 1911-1912, vice chairman from 1912-1913, substitute member of the church council from 1928-1929, thereafter regular member. Study visits to Germany in 1907-1908 and 1930. Writings: The Prayer in the Old Testament (doctoral dissertation, 1914), The Use of the Bible in School and Seminary Exercises, Pictures from the History of the Church for elementary school (1934), reviews, etc. Knight of the North Star Order.
